author: undetermined
full_text:
I apologize, but the provided HTML content appears to be a form for searching Executive Record Sheets of IAS Officers, not a fact-check article. The HTML contains a web form with input fields for selecting allotment year, cadre, and name, along with some disclaimer text. There is no substantive fact-checking content to extract.

The page seems to be part of a government personnel information system, specifically a platform for searching Indian Administrative Service (IAS) officer records. It includes input fields for:
- Allotment Year
- Cadre Selection
- Officer Name

Would you like me to clarify anything specific about this HTML document?
title: The message circulating on social media in the name of a retired IAS Sachin Paul is most likely fictional, as we could not find any IAS officer with the name Sachin Paul in the list of IAS officers served to date.
vclaim: The text appears to be a meta-description of a web form for searching IAS officer records rather than a fact-check article containing claims to verify.
